title.narrative: Support to the NC and Parliame

description.narrative: Support to the National Coordinator on Implementation of Sustainable Development Goals and Strengthening the Role of the Parliament in the Implementation of Sustainable Development Goals

participating-org.narrative: Min of Foreign Affairs of RB
United Nations Fund for Population Activities

provider-org.narrative: United Nations Fund for Population Activities
United Nations Fund for Population Activities

description.narrative: 1.1 Expert and technical assistance provided to the Ministry of Foreign Affairs as the Secretariat of the National Coordinator on implementation of Sustainable Development Goals and Council for Sustainable Development 1.2 Availability of the informational materials on the SDGs 2.1 Number of events with the participation of national and foreign partners on implementation of the SDGs by the Republic of Belarus 2.2 Availability of information materials for promoting the activity of the National Coordinator on implementation of the SDGs, including with participation of the parliamentarians and the Council for Sustainable Development 3.1 Number of study visits abroad of the National Coordinator on implementation of the SDGs and parliamentarians for experience exchange and promotion of the best practices

comment.narrative:
The Agenda for Sustainable Development for the period until 2030 (Agenda 2030) was adopted at the UN Summit in 2015. Agenda 2030 sets out the principle "leave no one behind" and is supported by an interlinked set of 17 Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs). Each country is encouraged to implement the Agenda 2030 and the SDGs to track progress and to inform the UN on the progress of their implementation. The SDGs will be implemented and monitored against national indicators included in the national plans and development strategies. Thus, “localization” is one of the key elements in the implementation of the SDGs. The Parliament plays an important role in supporting all these efforts. The SDGs replaced the Millennium Development Goals that were successfully achieved by the Republic of Belarus before the deadline. Belarus attaches great importance to the successful implementation of the Agenda 2030 and the SDGs. "Nationalization" of the SDGs has been initiated by the Republic of Belarus with the establishment of the post of National Coordinator on implementation of Sustainable Development Goals and the establishment under his/her leadership the Council for Sustainable Development. The Ministry of Foreign Affairs performs the function of the Secretariat of the National Coordinator on implementation of Sustainable Development Goals. Belarus has become one of 44 countries that will present national reviews on SDGs implementation at the political forum of the UN high-level forum on sustainable development in July 2017 at the headquarters of UN in New York.
The UNDP intends to support the efforts of the Government and the Parliament of the Republic of Belarus in implementation of the Agenda 2030 and the SDGs.
The undisputable importance of cooperation between the Parliament of the Republic of Belarus and the United Nations Development Programme stems from the overall shared commitment to support the Parliament’s role in SDGs implementation.
UNDP signed the United Nations

1. Support to the National Coordinator on implementation of Sustainable Development Goals and Council for Sustainable Development is provided. 2. Involvement of the Parliament in the issues of SDGs implementation is increased. 3. International cooperation in the context of SDGs is enhanced

1. - The Meeting of the regional working groups on Sustainable Development Goals was held 28 November 2018, in the Brest Science and Technology Park. 86 participants, including the National Coordinator on SDGs, representatives of the sectoral groups on SDGs of the Council for Sustainable Development, parliamentary and regional SDGs working groups, partner group for sustainable development and UN agencies attended this meeting. The representatives of the Council for Sustainable Development, parliamentary and regional SDGs working groups, international expert (Astrid Zaam, Executive Director of the Dortmund International Education Center, Head of the Belarus Support Program for the Federal Government of Germany), national expert (Tarasyuk Sergei, Director of the International Fund for Rural Development (NGO) made presentation about SDG localization. - Expert and technical support was provided in holding the international symposium «Education for sustainable development for all generations - social contract». The handouts were designed, printed and distributed among the 400 participants of the symposium. Two presentations about SDG Accelerators were made by the Project Manager in two sessions of the symposium. - The workshop for the national and regional media representatives on SDGs was held on 15 November 2018 in Minsk. 70 participants, including the National Coordinator on SDGs, the Minister of information (representatives of the national and regional media) attended the workshop. The international experts (Nicolas Douillet, Communication Specialist, UNDP Regional Hub and Heike Janssen, NGO “Sustainable Development and Journalism” (Germany), the representatives of the partnership group for sustainable development shared thier expirience in promotion of SDGs and involvment of media representatives in popularization of SDGs. - Communication materials for children and youth on the explanation of the Agenda-2030 and 17 SDG were developed in cooperation with the children magazine Vyaselka . 3000 copies of the children magazines Vyaselka (№ 12) with information of SDG were distributed among the children within the project. 250 pins with SDGs logo and 250 linen bags were produced and will be distributed during the National SDG Forum. The comics contest for the best superhero for achieving the Sustainable Development Goals Superheroes for Super Goals was launched. More than 500 comics was received. -Technical support in the functioning and update of the national website for sustainable development (www.sdgs.by) was provided by the expert: web-site restructures, more than 35 news and events published. 2. The meeting of the parliamentary group on SDGs for assessing the implementation of the parliamentary hearings recommendations on SDGs (adopted in December, 2017) was held on 17 December 2018. 28 participants, including the members of the parliamentary group on SDGs, the Council for Sustainable Development, the representatives of the partnership group for sustainable development, UN agencies attended the meeting. The Deputy Ministers of Environment, Information, Education and Housing and Communal Services reported about the progress in implementation of SDGs. 3. Support was provided for the National Coordinator and the representatives of the organizations involved in the SDG implementation to attend the World Economic Forum’s Sustainable Development Impact Summit 2018, New York, USA 23-27 September 2018 (National Coordinator on SDGs and the representative of the MFA); the Baku Forum on Sustainable Development, 25-26 October 2018, Baku, Azerbaijan (National Coordinator on SDGs and the representatives of the MFA and the Council of Republic); the International conference on Innovation and investment as an effective basis for the development of women’s entrepreneurship in domestic and international markets, Tashkent (Uzbekistan), 23-24 November 2018 (National Coordinator on SDGs and the representatives of the partnership group for sustainable development)
1. Support to the National Coordinator on implementation of Sustainable Development Goals and Council for Sustainable Development is provided.
1. A national review of the implementation of the Agenda – 2030 in the format of the National Forum on Sustainable Development held 24 January 2019 in Minsk (450 participants).
